Package com.bakdata.dedupe.classifier

Class RuleBasedClassifier<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bakdata.dedupe.classifier.RuleBasedClassifier<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the record.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Classifier<T>
    public final class RuleBasedClassifier<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Classifier<T>
    Successively applies a list of rules to the record and returns the respective ClassificationResult with the following cases:
    • If any rule classifies the pair unambiguously as Classification.DUPLICATE or Classification.NON_DUPLICATE, the classification is immediately returned.
    • If no rule can be applied, the classification is defaultClassificationResult.
    There are three types of rules:
    • Negatives rule are used to exclude false positives. For example, when two person records have completely different social security numbers, we want to declare them non-duplicate, even if they share the same name. Negative rules are usually combined with explicit or implicit preconditions (e.g., different SSN).
    • A positive rule is used to explicitly include true positives. Positive rules can be used as exceptions of negative rules or for very specific edge cases that are hard to model in a stable overall similarity measure. For example, a person has changed the last name after marriage, so we exclude the last name of comparison and make everything else stricter. Positive rules are usually combined with explicit or implicit preconditions (e.g., different last name).
    • Threshold rules classify a pair as a duplicate if above over a given threshold or as non-duplicate otherwise. These rules are usually at the end of the rule list and are evaluated if no special case has been handled with positive or negative rules. By convention, the last rule is dubbed the default rule that should also not have any preconditions.
    The Classification will contain a description naming the triggered rule and converts the rule score into a confidence score.

      Nested Classes

      static class  RuleBasedClassifier.Rule<T>
      A rule has a name for lineage/debugging and the similarity measure.
      static class  RuleBasedClassifier.RuleBasedClassifierBuilder<T>
      A builder for RuleBasedClassifier with convenience methods to create positive and negative rules.

      • getRules

        @NonNull
public @NonNull java.util.List<RuleBasedClassifier.Rule<T>> getRules()
        The set of rules that are applied in the order of addition. The first rule that can be applied and gives a Classification that is not unknown determines the ClassificationResult.

      • getDefaultClassificationResult

        public ClassificationResult getDefaultClassificationResult()
        Fallback value, when no rule applied. By default, a result with Classification.UNKNOWN is returned.
